definition: to pull out/to allocate (funds)/to dial
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: It is suggested that the government should make efforts to set aside an appropriate fund for the vegetable basket program.
sentences.chinese: 人们建议政府应该做出努力，为菜篮子工程拨出专款。

sentences.english: They set aside 50 mu for an experimental farm.
sentences.chinese: 他们拨出50亩地作实验农场。

sentences.english: First, the government should allocate resources for promoting economic development.
sentences.chinese: 首先，预算案须拨出资源推动经济发展。

sentences.english: China a spared more than two billion yuan for the fight against SARA.
sentences.chinese: 为抗非典，中国拨出了二十多亿人民币。

sentences.english: Thanks for helping me with this project. I appreciate your time.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你拨出时间来帮助这项计划。

sentences.english: China's Ministry of Finance has allocated $123 million in aid for quake-hit areas.
sentences.chinese: 中国财政部已经为灾区拨出一亿两千三百万救灾款。

sentences.english: The government anted up a large sum of money to build a testing center.
sentences.chinese: 政府拨出巨款建立一个试验中心。

sentences.english: N. If you hit the carotid artery , pull the needle out and hold pressure for 5 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 如果误刺到颈动脉，拨出穿刺针并按压5分钟。

sentences.english: The President is Commander-in-Chief of the army, but Congress appropriates money for a standing army.
sentences.chinese: 总统是军队的统帅，但军费是由国会拨出的。

sentences.english: Meanwhile they set aside part of their funds for the motorized boats.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，他们拨出一部分资金购买机帆船。

sentences.english: The Ford Foundation allocated millions of dollars for cancer re-search.
sentences.chinese: 福特基金会拨出几百万元作为问癌症的研究。

sentences.english: Second, he must always keep his mind fresh by setting aside some time for exercise.
sentences.chinese: 其次，他必须拨出时间来运动以保持头脑清楚。

sentences.english: A little digging will pull up some good online information.
sentences.chinese: 略微在线挖掘一下，就会拨出一些好消息。

definition: to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
to allocate funds/appropriation
to fish out/to take out (from a pocket, bag etc)
to raise (money)
to utilize/to put sth to use
special fund/money allocated for a particular purpose
to sow discord
to send (products)/to allocate/to commit (funds)/to channel (goods)
to make (some time or space) available (for sb)
to help/to support/to aid/aid/assistance
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
cut off/disconnect
to deposit (e.g. in a bank account)
to summon/to muster/to assemble
to press down/to press a button
to connect/to put through
to regain/to retake/to take back/to withdraw/to revoke
